BF.AbilityAssignment.Label: Determine Ability Scores
BF.AbilityAssignment.ScoringMethods.Hint: There are three methods to determine your starting ability scores. No method is “better” than another, but some people like one way more, so we include them to appeal to different kinds of players.
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.Manual.Label: Manual Assignment
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.Rolling.Hint: This is the classic, providing surprises and maybe a tough choice. It helps make a character you adapt to, instead of you making all the decisions.
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.PointBuy.Hin: If you don’t want to leave it up to chance, you can assign ability scores with the point-buy method.
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.StandardArra: To get started faster, use the standard array.
BF.AccentColor.Label: Accent Color
BF.Activity.Core.Description.Label: Description
BF.Activity.Core.Warning.NoTargets: You must have one or more tokens controlled or an assigned character.
BF.Activity.Config.Title: Configure {item} Activity
BF.Activity.Damage.IncludeBaseDamage.Hin: Include the weapon's base damage along with any additional damage parts defined in the activity.
BF.Activity.Selection.Title: Select Activity
BF.Activity.Attack.Title: Attack
BF.Activity.Attack.Hint: Make an attack and roll damage.
BF.Activity.Healing.Title: Healing
BF.Activity.SavingThrow.Title: Saving Throw
BF.Activity.SavingThrow.Hint: Force a saving throw and roll damage.
BF.Activity.Utility.Title: Utility
BF.Actor.Category.Person.Label: Person
BF.Advancement.Label: Advancement
BF.Advancement.Core.Title.Label: Custom Title
BF.Advancement.Core.Hint.Label: Hint
BF.Advancement.Core.Icon.Label: Custom Icon
BF.Advancement.Core.ClassRestriction.Hin: Should this advancement only be applied for the first class taken on an actor or only when multiclassing into this class?
BF.Advancement.Core.Level.Reference.Hint: Is this advancement based off overall character level, or a specific class's level?
BF.Advancement.Config.Title: Configure {item} Advancement
BF.Advancement.Config.DropHint: Drop Items here to add them to this advancement.
BF.Advancement.Config.AllowDrops.Label: Allow Drops
BF.Advancement.Config.AllowDrops.Hint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?
BF.Advancement.Config.Warning.Duplicate: That item already exists on this advancement.
BF.Advancement.Config.Warning.Invalid: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
BF.Advancement.Config.Warning.Recursive: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
BF.Advancement.Selection.Title: Select Advancement Type
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Title: Choose Features
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Hint: Present the player with a choice of features or talents that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Choices.Hi: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Drop: Drop a {type} here to select it
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Type.Label: Item Type
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Warning.Pr: This feature has already been chosen at a previous level.
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Warning.Ty: Only {type} can be selected for this choice.
BF.Advancement.ExpandedTalentList.Title: Expanded Talent List
BF.Advancement.ExpandedTalentList.Hint: Give players access to a second talent list when choosing talents during improvement.
BF.Advancement.ExpandedTalentList.Journa: When your {classLowercase} level grants you an Improvement and you choose to gain a new talent, you can select a talent from the {talentLists} lists.
BF.Advancement.GrantFeatures.Title: Features
BF.Advancement.GrantFeatures.Hint: Grant the character features when they reach a certain level.
BF.Advancement.HitPoints.Title: Hit Points
BF.Advancement.HitPoints.Hint: Set an class's hit die size and track a player's hit points as they gain levels.
BF.Advancement.HitPoints.Notification: Hit points need to be increased
BF.Advancement.Improvement.Title: Improvement
BF.Advancement.Improvement.Hint: Allow the player to increase one ability score and choose a talent from a specific talent list.
BF.Advancement.Improvement.JournalDescri: Increase one ability score of your choice by 1 and choose a talent for which you meet the prerequisites from the {talentList} list.
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Title: Key Ability
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Hint: Specify the key & secondary abilities on a class, giving the player an option if there is more than one, and granting the actor the appropriate saving throw proficiencies.
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Options.Label: Key Ability Options
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Options.Hint: Player can choose from one of these ability options as their key ability.
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Secondary.Hint: One secondary ability in which the player will also get a save proficiency.
BF.Advancement.Property.Title: Set Property
BF.Advancement.Property.Hint: Change one or more actor properties using a system similar to active effects.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Title: Scale Value
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Hint: A single value that changes with level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Identifier.Hin: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{parentIdentifier}.{identifier} in a formula.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Item.Label: Associated Item
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Item.Hint: This scale value will be displayed inline with this item when displaying in a journal table. If not provided, this scale value will be displayed in its own column.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.Label: Data Type
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.CR.Label: Challenge Rating
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.CR.Hint: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.Dice.Hint: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration or sneak attack.
Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed or aura of protection radius.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.Number.Hi: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.String.Hi: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.
BF.Advancement.ScaleValue.Type.Usage.Hin: Use this for an item's uses.
BF.Advancement.Size.Title: Size
BF.Advancement.Size.Hint: Set a character's size or give them a choice of sizes.
BF.Advancement.Size.Options.Label: Size Options
BF.Advancement.Size.Options.Hint: Player can choose from any selected size. If only one is selected, then their character will become that size automatically.
BF.Advancement.Spellcasting.Title: Spellcasting
BF.Advancement.Spellcasting.Hint: Give a character the ability to learn and cast spells.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Title: Traits
BF.Advancement.Trait.Hint: Grant a character certain traits of proficiencies or present them a choice.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Label: Choice Mode
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Hint: Method by which the player is able to select from the choice sets.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Exclusi: Player can make a choice from only one set of choices.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Inclusi: Player will be able to choose from all available sets of choices.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choices.Label: Choices
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choices.Hint: The following traits will be presented as a choice to the player.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Count.Label: Count
BF.Advancement.Trait.Guaranteed.Label: Guaranteed
BF.Advancement.Trait.Guaranteed.Hint: The following traits will be granted to the character.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Label: Mode
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Default.Label: Default
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Expertise.Hint: Gain expertise in a trait in which you already have proficiency.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Force.Label: Forced Expertise
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Force.Hint: Gain expertise in a trait regardless of your previous proficiency level.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Upgrade.Label: Upgrade
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Upgrade.Hint: Gain proficiency in a trait unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.

BF.Armor.Modifier.Label: Modifier
BF.Armor.Modifier.Maximum.Label: Maximum Modifier
BF.Armor.Modifier.Minimum.Label: Minimum Modifier
BF.Armor.Notification.NotProficient: Using {type} without proficiency results in disadvantage on STR & DEX ability checks.
BF.Armor.Property.Cumbersome.Label: Cumbersome
BF.Armor.Property.NaturalMaterials.Label: Natural Materials
BF.Armor.Property.Noisy.Label: Noisy
BF.Armor.RequiredStrength.Label: Required Strength
BF.Armor.Value.Label: Armor Value
BF.ArmorClass.Label: Armor Class
BF.ArmorClass.Flat.Label: Flat Value
BF.ArmorClass.Flat.Hint: Arbitrary that is made available to AC formulas such as Natural Armor.
BF.ArmorClass.Override.Label: Override
BF.ArmorClass.Override.Hint: Value that will replace the calculated AC, preventing any other bonuses from applying.
BF.Attack.Classification.Label: Classification
BF.ChallengeRating.Label: Challenge Rating
BF.ConceptSelection.Title: Select {type}
BF.ConceptSelection.NoOptions: No {typePlural} could be found, create a {type} in the world or enabled a compendium containing {typePlural}.
BF.ConceptSelection.Warning.Duplicate: A {type} already exists on the actor {name}.
BF.ConceptSelection.Warning.InvalidType: Documents of the type {type} cannot be set using the setConcept method.

Blinded.Label: Blinded
Blinded.NoteAbilityChecks: A blinded creature automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Blinded.NoteAttackRolls: A blinded creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

Deafened.Label: Deafened
Deafened.Note: A deafened creature automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

Exhaustion.Label: Exhaustion
Exhaustion.NoteAbilityChecks: A creature with one level of exhaustion has disadvantage on ability checks.
Exhaustion.NoteAttackRollsSaves: A creature with three levels of exhaustion has disadvantage on attack rolls and saves.

Frightened.Label: Frightened
Frightened.Note: A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and atttack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.

Invisible.Label: Invisible
Invisible.Note: An invisible creature has advantage on DEX (Stealth) checks made to Hide.

Paralyzed.Label: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.Note: A paralyzed creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

Petrified.Label: Petrified
Petrified.Note: A petrified creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

Poisoned.Label: Poisoned
Poisoned.Note: A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Prone.Label: Prone
Prone.Note: A prone creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.

Restrained.Label: Restrained
Restrained.Note: A restrained creature has disadvantage on DEX saves and attack rolls.

Stunned.Label: Stunned
Stunned.Note: A stunned creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

Unconscious.Label: Unconscious
Unconscious.Note: An unconscious creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

When you reach 3rd level, choose a subclass from the options presented below.

KnownInLife.Label: All Languages Known in Life
KnownInLife.Display: all languages it knew in life

BF.LegendaryAction.Description: The {type} can take {count} legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The {type} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
BF.LegendaryAction.Max.Label: Legendary Actions per Round
BF.Level.Warning.Max: Character cannot be leveled up past {max}.

Warning.OnlyOneReroll: Only a single re-roll is allowed.

Long.Full: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel} and {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
Long.HitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
Long.HitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.

Short.Full: {name} takes a short rest and spends {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel} to recover {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.

Long.Label: Long Rest
Long.Hint: At the end of a long rest, you regain all lost hit points. You also regain spent hit dice, up to half of your maximum (minimum of 1).

Short.Label: Short Rest
Short.Hint: You can spend one or more hit dice at the end of a short rest, up to your maximum number of hit dice.

BF.Roll.ExtraTerms.Label: Extra Terms

BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionManual.Label: Allow Manual Ability Assignments
BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionManual.Hint: Allow players to manually set their ability scores rather than using the standard selection methods.
BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionReroll.Label: Allow Re-rolls on Ability Scores
BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionReroll.Hint: Allow players to re-roll when using the rolling ability score selection method.
BF.Settings.CriticalMaximizeDamage.Label: Critical: Maximize Bonus Dice
BF.Settings.CriticalMaximizeDamage.Hint: Maximize the value of bonus dice added by criticals (e.g. 1d6 becomes 1d6 + 6 rather than 2d6).
BF.Settings.CriticalMultiplyDice.Label: Critical: Multiply Dice Result
BF.Settings.CriticalMultiplyDice.Hint: Multiply dice terms rather than rolling additional dice (e.g. 1d6 becomes 1d6 * 2 rather than 2d6).
BF.Settings.CriticalMultiplyNumeric.Hint: Multiply numeric terms in addition to dice terms (e.g. 1d6 + 4 becomes 2d6 + 8 rather than 2d6 + 4).
BF.Settings.InitiativeTiebreaker.Label: Initiative Tiebreaker
BF.Settings.InitiativeTiebreaker.Hint: Add initiative ability score as decimal to help break ties in initiatives.
BF.Settings.LevelingMode.Label: Leveling Mode
BF.Settings.LevelingMode.Hint: Method that should be used to determine when players gain a new level.
BF.Settings.Multiclassing.Label: Allow Multiclassing
BF.Settings.Multiclassing.Hint: Let characters take more than one class when leveling.
BF.Settings.ProficiencyMode.Label: Proficiency Variant
BF.Settings.ProficiencyMode.Hint: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll.

BF.Spellcasting.Progression.Label: Spellcasting Progression
BF.Spellcasting.Progression.Hint: Determines how many spell slots a caster has available at any given level. Generally casters who gain spellcasting at 1st level are full casters, 2nd level are half, and 3rd level are third.
